thread.title: Police activity sends Beaverton elementary school into lockout
thread.title_full: Police activity sends Beaverton elementary school into lockout | OregonLive.com

author: Rebecca Woolington | The Oregonian/OregonLive
title: Police activity sends Beaverton elementary school into lockout
text:
2:05 p.m. update: The lockout at the school has been lifted, according to Beaverton Police.
Chehalem Elementary School in Beaverton has been placed in lockout because of nearby police activity.
Police have responded to a man threatening to hurt himself in his home near Southwest Village Lane and Glenbrook Road , said Officer Mike Rowe, a Beaverton Police spokesman. The school is in lockout as a precaution, he said.
-- Rebecca Woolington
rwoolington@oregonian.com
503-294-4049; @rwoolington
